intro: Zappania bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by bracts that give it its common name. Zappania bracteosa is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain areas.
